attributes.action: Posthumously award John 'Jock' Stein the Knighthood that he should have recieved!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
He guided Celtic to victory in the final of the 1967 European Cup and did not recieve the accolade that he should have...Sir Matt Busby recieved a knighthood the following year for doing the same thing with Manchester United.

Most believe that the award was pulled for Jock after the infamous Intercontinental cup game.

So come on people this is a travesty or is it just that it was a Scottish team that managed it first?

Tommy Docherty at a dinner in Hull a few weeks ago said 'How he never got a knighthood I'll never know' at which point someone shouted out 'It's because he was Scottish!'

Oh well!

Jock Stein Legend of the game!

rejection.details: A knighthood is an honour only given during someone's lifetime. Unlike bravery awards and medals, they have never been granted posthumously.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
